cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move generally north then north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern half of the Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the Florida Big Bend, greatest threat over Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may bring gusts to near tropical-storm force (30-40 mph) late Tuesday into Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Offshore winds on the Mississippi coast should limit surge, only minor coastal water level fluctuations expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in outer rainbands Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave action may disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations
